attributes.additional_details:
Essex street light switch-off blamed for crime surge
13 July 2014 Last updated at 13:33 BST
People in Essex are blaming a spate of accidents and an increase in crime on the county council's decision to switch off street lights for five hours during the night.
attributes.background:
Street lights will be turned on for an extra hour across Essex following a decision by the county council.
About 70% of lights have been turned off between midnight and 05:00 since March 2013 to save £1m annually.Safety and crime concerns led some local councils to offer to fund the night lighting.

rejection.details:
In this case we think the issue is a matter within the responsibility of the local authority and not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could submit a petition calling on the Government to introduce legislation to (for example) require local authorities to keep street lighting switched on during the hours of darkness.
